thread.title: Trump Revamps White House Website; Energy Plan Is In, Climate Change Is Out
thread.title_full: Trump Revamps White House Website; Energy Plan Is In, Climate Change Is Out

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Revamps White House Website; Energy Plan Is In, Climate Change Is Out
text:
Trump Revamps White House Website; Energy Plan Is In, Climate Change Is Out "For too long, we’ve been held back ..." by Jack Davis January 20, 2017 at 2:21pm Advertisement - story continues below 
One click is all it takes to show that America has a new leader. 
The page on the official White House website that had discussed climate change is now gone. 
In its place, WhiteHouse,gov now touts President Donald Trump’s energy plan. Advertisement - story continues below Top Spiritual Adviser Paula White Reveals Trump’s ‘Heart For God’ 
“The Trump Administration is committed to energy policies that lower costs for hardworking Americans and maximize the use of American resources, freeing us from dependence on foreign oil,” the plan states. 
The plan shows the Obama administration’s focus on climate change as the driver of U.S. energy policy has been scrapped. 
“For too long, we’ve been held back by burdensome regulations on our energy industry. President Trump is committed to eliminating harmful and unnecessary policies such as the Climate Action Plan and the Waters of the U.S. rule. Lifting these restrictions will greatly help American workers, increasing wages by more than $30 billion over the next 7 years,” the plan says. Advertisement - story continues below 
The policy also foreshadows Trump’s plans for developing energy. 
“Sound energy policy begins with the recognition that we have vast untapped domestic energy reserves right here in America,” it says, noting America’s vast coal resources. 
The overhauled website no longer talks about the Affordable Care Act, and also has new sections that echo much of the Trump campaign’s proposals. 
For example, the law enforcement section shows a very different tone from the Obama administration’s approach. Advertisement - story continues below Bachmann Warns Of Pardon Coming For Hillary Clinton 
“Our job is not to make life more comfortable for the rioter, the looter, or the violent disrupter. Our job is to make life more comfortable for parents who want their kids to be able to walk the streets safely. Or the senior citizen waiting for a bus. Or the young child walking home from school,” the Trump White House page says. 
“Supporting law enforcement means supporting our citizens’ ability to protect themselves. We will uphold Americans’ Second Amendment rights at every level of our judicial system,” the page says. 
The section titled “Making Our Military Strong Again” not only pledges to boost cybersecurity, but also to protect the American mainland. 
“We will also develop a state-of-the-art missile defense system to protect against missile-based attacks from states like Iran and North Korea,” it says. 
In the section on foreign policy, the page sounds an aggressive tone of military expansion. 
”… we will rebuild the American military . Our Navy has shrunk from more than 500 ships in 1991 to 275 in 2016. Our Air Force is roughly one third smaller than in 1991. President Trump is committed to reversing this trend, because he knows that our military dominance must be unquestioned,” the page reads. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below.
